{"aid": "http://arxiv.org/abs/2504.20427v1", "title": "Trees in the Largest Order With a Given Burning Number", "summary": "Graph burning is modelled upon the spread of contagion, and the burning
number measures the speed of the spread. By the fact that the burning number of
a connected graph is the minimum burning number of its spanning trees, our work
focuses on identifying the largest order of a general tree with a given burning
number up to homeomorphism. In this work, we propose the concept of admissible
sequences over a homeomorphically irreducible tree in addition to developing a
general framework. We then determine whether an admissible sequence induces a
tree with a given burning number of the largest order. Additionally, we obtain
some results on the smallest attainable diameter of an $n$-spider having the
largest order with a given burning number.", "main_category": "math.CO", "categories": "math.CO", "published": "2025-04-29T04:45:57Z"}
